text: Kathleen Ann Goonan (May 14, 1952 â€“ January 28, 2021)Kathleen Ann Goonan (1952-2021), by Mike Glyer, at File 770; published January 28, 2021; retrieved January 28, 2021 was an American science fiction writer. Many of her books have been nominated for the Nebula Award. Her first novel Queen City Jazz was a New York Times Notable Book of the Year. Her novel In War Times was chosen by the American Library Association as Best Science Fiction Novel in 2008.American Library Association 2008 Reading List, accessed online. Goonan was born in Cincinnati, Ohio. Goonan died on January 28, 2021 from bone cancer, aged 68. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Cancer deaths in the United States Category:American novelists Category:American science fiction writers Category:Writers from Cincinnati
title: Kathleen Ann Goonan
